intro: Packera paupercula var. pseudotomentosa, commonly known as the Hoary Groundsel, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its botanical features make it well adapted to its alpine and subalpine environments.
